Class Vector3D

java.lang.Object
  Vector3D

public class Vector3D
extends java.lang.Object

A simple class for representing vectors with three real components.

Author:
Justin Johnson

Constructor Summary
Vector3D()
          Creates a new vector with zero for each component.
Vector3D(double[] coords)
          Creates a new vector whose coordinates are specified by an array.
Vector3D(double x, double y, double z)
          Creates a new vector with the specified coordinates.
 
Method Summary
 Vector3D cross(Vector3D other)
          Returns a new vector which is the cross product of this and another vector.
 double[] getCoords()
          Returns an array containing the coordinates of this vector.
 Vector3D minus(Vector3D other)
          Returns a new vector which is this minus another vector.
 double norm()
          Returns the Euclidean norm of this vector.
 Vector3D normalize()
          Returns a new vector which is a normalized version of this vector.
 Vector3D plus(Vector3D other)
          Returns a new vector which is the sum of this and another vector.
 Vector3D times(double val)
          Returns a new vector which is a scalar multiple of this vector.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Creates a new vector with the specified coordinates.

Vector3D

public Vector3D(double[] coords)
Creates a new vector whose coordinates are specified by an array.

Parameters:
coords - The array specifying the coordinates of this array. Coords must be an array of length 3.
Method Detail

plus

public Vector3D plus(Vector3D other)
Returns a new vector which is the sum of this and another vector.

Parameters:
other - The vector to add to this.
Returns:
The sum of this and other.

minus

public Vector3D minus(Vector3D other)
Returns a new vector which is this minus another vector.

Parameters:
other - The vector to subtract from this.
Returns:
The difference (this - other)

times

public Vector3D times(double val)
Returns a new vector which is a scalar multiple of this vector.

Parameters:
val - The scalar by which to multiply this vector.
Returns:
A new vector whose value is val * this.

cross

public Vector3D cross(Vector3D other)
Returns a new vector which is the cross product of this and another vector.

Parameters:
other - The vector with which to take the cross product.
Returns:
A new vector whose value is this cross other.

norm

public double norm()
Returns the Euclidean norm of this vector.

normalize

public Vector3D normalize()
Returns a new vector which is a normalized version of this vector.

getCoords

public double[] getCoords()
Returns an array containing the coordinates of this vector.
